Structure and Function: Nerve Cells. Neurons are nerve cells that originate, process, transmit, and receive nerve impulses. They are connected to other neurons or to cells in muscles, organs, or glands. In addition to features common to all cells, such as a nucleus, neurons have specialized projections, known as nerve fibres (axons), that carry nerve signals.
